Dress in layers with a warm winter coat, waterproof boots, gloves, and a hat. Don't forget an umbrella and waterproof clothing to stay dry during your outdoor activities.

Additionally, carrying a few pairs of warm socks and comfortable shoes will help keep you cozy while exploring the city's attractions. Don't forget to bring moisturizer and lip balm to combat dryness due to the cool weather. An umbrella or raincoat might be useful as well, as there can be occasional light showers.

name: Delhi
note: March marks the onset of spring in Delhi, with temperatures gradually rising. The days can be warm and pleasant, averaging around 30°C (86°F), while nights remain cooler at about 15°C (59°F). Light and breathable clothing, such as cotton shirts and trousers, are recommended during the day, along with a light jacket or shawl for the evenings. name: Delhi
note: April brings hot and dry weather to Delhi, with temperatures soaring as high as 40°C (104°F) during the day. It's essential to pack lightweight and loose-fitting clothing made of breathable fabrics to stay cool and comfortable. Sunscreen with high SPF, a wide-brimmed hat, and sunglasses are crucial to shield yourself from the scorching sun. Carry a reusable water bottle and stay hydrated throughout the day. Seek shade and avoid strenuous outdoor activities during peak afternoon hours when the heat is most intense.

name: Delhi
note: May is the hottest month in Delhi, with temperatures often exceeding 45°C (113°F). Prepare for extreme heat by packing lightweight, airy clothing that covers your skin, and opt for light colors to reflect the sun's rays. Stay indoors or explore air-conditioned attractions during the hottest hours. Carry a portable fan, a cooling towel, and extra electrolyte-rich drinks to combat dehydration. Heatstroke prevention is crucial, so take it easy and avoid excessive sun exposure. Consider staying in accommodations with air conditioning during this scorching period.

name: Delhi
note: June marks the arrival of the monsoon season in Delhi, bringing relief from the intense heat. While temperatures range from 35°C (95°F) during the day to 26°C (79°F) at night, the humidity levels rise significantly due to frequent rain showers. Pack lightweight, quick-drying clothing and a foldable umbrella or raincoat to stay dry. Waterproof shoes or sandals are recommended to navigate through the occasionally flooded streets. Be cautious of mosquito-borne diseases and carry mosquito repellent. It's also advisable to have a waterproof bag for protecting your belongings.

name: Delhi
note: July continues with the monsoon, and heavy rainfall is common in Delhi. Temperatures remain moderate, ranging from 33°C (91°F) to 27°C (81°F). Pack rain-friendly attire like waterproof jackets and pants, as well as water-resistant footwear. Carry a sturdy backpack to protect your belongings from the rain. Explore indoor attractions such as museums, art galleries, and shopping malls during frequent downpours. Keep an eye on weather forecasts and be prepared for potential travel disruptions due to heavy rainfall.

name: Delhi
note: The monsoon continues into August, with similar weather patterns as July. Expect moderate temperatures ranging from 33°C (91°F) during the day to 27°C (81°F) at night. Keep packing rain gear and waterproof clothing to stay comfortable outdoors. Carrying a compact umbrella and a waterproof camera cover will come in handy for sightseeing during showers. Be cautious of slippery surfaces, and avoid venturing into waterlogged areas. August might offer lower travel crowds due to the rain, making it an excellent time for budget-conscious travelers.

name: Delhi
